reviewText:
Early Access Review

I'm a big fan of Early Access games.  You get to experience the journey of development as the game progresses and as new features get implemented it is like receiving regular gifts.

I've just had to use Task Manager to quit out of Dungeons & Robots 5-10 times in the space of 15 minutes.  I've had problems with controls, the sound and the menus.  It's just not even playable in its current state.

This is the type of release that gives Early Access a bad name.  The devs need to fix the basics before collecting cash from people.

Refund requested.  Maybe I come back later in a year and see how it's going.

edited review to change EA to = Early Access.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game is a really fun top-down ARPG shooter, it has an excellent concept and I highly recommend this game to those that want to join, play the game, and make it the best.

I would like to note that currently this game is very alpha.  There will be bugs and glitches.  The game does need some serious quick polish to get it to at least beta status.  BUT the core concept of the game is great, it has some really huge potential.  So I would only buy this game if you really want to help the game improve, otherwise I would follow and wait for some patches to roll out.

As I said above, the game is a top-down/isometric shooter.  What makes this fun is that you don't click to move, you do so by using WASD and you shoot your guns with left click and right click, which makes combat very interactive.  You have 4 skills that you can have and equip, an example is one that increases your attack speed and you have 1 armor ability that you get when you wear certain armors.

There are two game modes currently, defense mode where you defend a certain object against waves of enemies.  The other one is explorer mode where you get a random objective and have to complete them, an example is to collect X amount, or escorting a person to the exit.  For combat it all boils down to pretty much kiting and shooting aliens until they are dead, they have some variety in their attacks, but not that much.

For character customization there are a lot of things you can do.  Each character has a skill list where you can put points, into a variety of different stats such as increase damage, increase health, increase armor, etc... Best thing is you can re-roll your points any time you want (when you're not in a game), this allows you to experiement with different builds.  You earn these skill points by leveling up your character and to level up you complete mission objectives and gain experience at the end.

Another great thing is you can customize the looks of your robot.  You can find different armor and weapon pieces when you play, they are random drops in the level, and they change your looks.  Another great thing is that these pieces have random stats on them, so not every piece is the same, this will give you further character customization.  Also you can craft gear by finding crystals in the dungeon and have a chance to make a rare.

Lastly with regarding modifications, you can upgrade your armor and weapon pieces, they increase defense and attack respectively.  There can be other modifications too, but that I haven't discoverd yet.

One feature this game has that I'm not too fond of and I'm sure other as well, is an online only game, there is currently no option for offline (no internet) play.  Reason is there are online features in this game such as guilds, auction house (will be in game in the future), and various co op modes.  For this price though I can look past this feature, but if it were any higher I wouldn't have bought it as I really don't like online only games.

From a singleplayer standpoint, the game is very playable.  I have been playing exclusively solo and been doing just fine.  Although the game is geared more towards co-op play though, but not needed if you don't want to.

From a hours:gameplay value, you will definitely get your money's worth and more.  Content-wise as in levels there isn't much at the moment (will be more soon), the hours come from farming for crystals, finding items, and crafting awesome gear for your character.

Overall the game has been great and really the sky's the limit, again, such huge potential.  Also, the devs are very active with the community.  Quick response and fixes, I don't know many games that have this kind of dev interaction, more games need to be like this.

I hope this review helps you in deciding if you should purchase the game or not.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I wanted to give this game a chance before I wrote a review about it. I will keep this short, sweet and to the point.

Pros:
Fun, cheap and unique art design with custom classes/builds, loot system.
Developers are very responsive and have been working hard to adress community issue(s).
Guilds

Cons:
A bit early on the EA side, IE the game came out yesterday on EA so it is a bit buggy.
(I wont list every bug because as a mature gamer you should know any EA has issues)
Cant customize colors on mechs/no real aethstic customization aside from what armor you have on. (A color option would be cool)

While this game still needs a good chunk of work, it has potential to be a nice On the side" kind of game for some people. While I don't reccomend someone buying it if they expect a feature complete game I am enjoying my time playing DnR."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Although it's getting frequent updates, it's becoming more and more impossible to play the game.  Monsters are getting tougher with each update which is all fine and well, but 350 damage weapons that consume massive amounts of energy deal a tenth of that to monsters who have several thousand hit points. It's not even possible to kill things anymore without being in a group but there aren't enough people playing to group up. While I felt this game had a bit of potential, they're making things worse with the updates instead of fixing the issues at hand and while they're fixing bugs, that doesn't account for much when you can't play the game bug free anyways.

- Weapons: they're terribly balanced. Some are just outright useless (Laser, Flamethrower) with the minigun being easily the best. It has almost as much damage per hit as the other weapons, is the most cost effective on Energy VS. DPS, and with the highest attack speed by far it's easily the highest DPS. there are also only 5 weapon types in the game at the moment, and one of them is pure support and the only possible substitute over miniguns so variety is slim.

- Frames: The light frames are poorly balanced as of now having little to no purpose on being in the game aside from your starter frame. They accel in neither tanking ability nor energy, and their default skill is useless compared to some others.

The medic has roughly the same hp/armor values and significantly higher energy allowing you to sustain damage longer along with a skill that full restores hp/energy to yourself and nearby allies letting them outshine light mechs who can only invuln for a bit until hit/hitting something or the 10 seconds are up.

Heavy mechs are definitely the tankiest but with how negligable armor feels right now and the inability to put their high weight limit to the task since there really isn't anything extremely heavy in the game.. they feel slightly underwhelming compared to medic frames, all the more so considering their slow speed causes them to take significantly longer on completing missions and often getting left behind. Heavier weapons with much higher values and the armor actually giving a significant decrease to damage taken would allow them to shine a bit more and giving them a higher regen value would also help so fingers crossed they actually give them a good purpose.

Stats - Health and armor can help slightly but with how hard mobs hit you'll want to be putting most of your effort into dodging, regeneration rates are the same across all frames and hp is so low that past a certain point it becomes nearly negligable. Energy regen being a flat 20 (28 with full upgrades to it from levels) also leaves no room for thought. That leaves you with mobility and energy values, and since energy is basically your amunition it easily takes priority to ensure you've enough sustained damage to kill things efficiently. Mobility is your best tool for survival so that does take some priority but any of the mechs can move around well enough to dodge most things without focusing too heavily on it (and with a high enough mobility it can actually be detrimental to your survivability causing you to run into things you can normally walk straight around) It further enhances the singular aspect of the game where you just want as much energy as possible with enough hp to take a couple hits in order to sustain your damage.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Very nice feeling overall.Needs a few fixes for sure. Knowing it is an early access release i think it has great potential and the developers update the game frequently. Bug fixes are out almost every day. Waiting for the PvP system implementation to see what it's like, because i think the most important feature of an online game for me is the PvP part.

PROS:
Good Graphics
Very nice visual effects
The requirements are very low
Frame rate very stable
Co op fun
Nice crafting system

CONS:
A few disconnects
Still a few bugs remaining to be fixed and key implementations
Missing map

We have to be realistic it's still an early access, it's not a final release. Very promising game. Can't wait for the next major update

reviewText:
Early Access Review

My Initial thoughts are as follows.

I feel like this game has a lot of potential, I want to first start off by saying that. Considering this game has just come out on early access if you do purchase the game there is not much content currently.

With that being said the Boss fights are a blast, Challenging, very eye appealing and will most definitely give you a challenge later on down the road.

There are two game modes currently available to play. Explorer, and Defend.

Explorer is a dungeon that you are thrown into where you have a main quest, and a challenge quest for extra experience at the end of the level. Throughout the level you are tasked with doing a few things where you will come across gear on the grown, crafting materials and traps.

While playing defend you have what looks like some object or base thing that you need to protect through various enemy waves.

This game so far looks gorgeous, runs pretty well considering the fact its just released. So yes you can expect a few bugs and things that do not run correctly but I know the developer is working hard on it and actively making the game better.

I do have to say that I am really excited to see what this game can become bacause it has the possibility to be extremly addicting expecially with your friends.

This game earns Ghost's Stamp of Approval.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game is a waste of time.

The game is great visually, but that's about it. Procedurally generated levels have no clear sign of where to go while a countdown timer ticks down as you hopelessly try to achieve your objective. I see a lot of potential, but when I first loaded the game and was welcomed with a black screen and music, I was a little concerned. I understand it's Early Access, but at least get me to the start screen. I had to trick the game into working by messing with my screen resolution.

The devs seem to be quick to respond to issues which is appreciated. This looks like it could be really fun, especially for the price!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I want to start this off by saying that the game is promising. It's a nice concept and the base for all the really good stuff is already there. When or if this game comes further along, I'll likely change my review. I intentionally played the game for under 2 hour so I would have the ability to refund it later if I did not think it was going to go anywhere.

PROS:
-Aesthetics:
It looks ♥♥♥♥ing great. Honestly, it does. The low poly style goes really nice with robots, although I can't say the same for some of the enemies.

-Customization:
Building your robot with different parts, although currently limited is actually really fun, and there are some pretty cool characters you can make. The game does let you have 5 different equipment set ups, that you're able to swap through in the menu and at a little pad near the start of each level.

-Ability to refund skill points
Skill points can be refunded for no cost any time. This is really great, as you can mess around and see which stats you think work the best for you.

CONS:
That's about it for what's good. For the rest of what I say, I wouldn't take it as why the game is bad, but rather what would make the game better. The only real reason I'm not playing more of this game right now is due to its clear lack of content and extremely repetitive missions".

-Repetitive "Missions":
I'm going to chalk this one up to the game still being fairly new. Currently there are only two modes
date: PvP and Explore. I have not been able to play PvP yet
recommended: as basically no one plays this game (got to about rank 50 world after 1.5 hours). Explore is really misleading
hoursPlayed: because it's not exploration at all. You just walk through a very linear cave system filled with enemies
voteText: and you're offered two goals. The main goal is always the same
helpfulPercent: although they give them different names
votesHelpful: you're basically just going up to objectives and pressing F. Once you've pressed F on enough different objectives
votesTotal: you head to the boss and leave. You can go to the boss before hand
votesFunny: but you won't get any loot if you haven't completed at least one objective. The sub objectives are really well done
commentsCount: they're basically just a small randomized goal. Collect X amount of X crafting materials
column16: crit X number of times or don't change your loadout during the mission. These accomplish their goal pretty well
column17:
and offer an extra chance at loot when completed.

-Artificial difficulty:
The game never actually becomes more challenging. Just harder to do the same exact thing you were doing. More enemies with higher stats. It gets to the point where you'll just be swarmed and killed in the same spot over and over again unless you press the 'escape' button and select the suicide command

column19: but I'll bring that back up in a bit. I don't mind the enemies getting more stats

column22: it's better to just ignore all the enemies and run past everything while completing the objectives. You don't get anything for killing them anyways
column23: except 1 random crafting material sometimes. With the game being called an action rpg you would think fighting would be the main focus. If combat in a combat centered game become something you'd rather just avoid altogether
column24:
then there is very little reason to keep playing.

-Basic attacks cost power:
This really got me upset

The power mechanic is frustrating and sucks. It'd be easier to and a lot more fun to just change it to an overheat system. The support abilities' power costs are virtually nonexistent

When I hear robots I think about weapons, LOTS of weapons.

Back mounted miniguns.

SHINING FINGER! -G Gundam

Our robots only have two weapon slots.

HAND BASED WEAPON SLOTS.

That being said, it's not bad, it didn't crash on me, gameplay works.

I hope that I'll be able to use at least 8 weapons at once in the future as development continues.

----

Edit: ALSO THE ENERGY SYSTEM IS WEIRD. Whats the point of having more than one weapon if you can't regen energy while firing either weapon?!

Even if you don't have energy and aren't firing either weapon, if you hold down the mouse you won't regen energy.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

3/2/2016, is the third day this game has been out. All the bad reviews are from the first day with in hours of playing the game. EARLY ACCESS means the DEV's are going to be fixing the problems with game. I personally didn't see anything wrong that would make someone quit or Rage on Review's to give it a bad rep.

Why should you listen to me, well because it is the 3rd day and i have almost 30 hours of playing time. LOL
This Game.
It's alot more fun than the pictures show. Graphics are good or at least on my 46 inch TV they are LOL. It's a dungeon game and a leveling game and a crafting game that keeps track of your stats, and has a leaderboard system.

What makes the game fun.
For me, i like playing with other people, Co Op is up to 4 people. You can make a guild at level 3, and after that you play with friends. The dungeons are pretty basic, But where it keeps you playing the game is the crafting and item finding and than the turf wars. You see in the game you conquor land with your guild. That is what will keep you on your toes.
This game does not have quest like some dungeon games. But when you click co op or solo play it randomly gives you a misson to do. You also can choose different modes to play from easy  to normal to hard ex..... Now all the issues people listed in the bad reviews the dev's are working on them. For the price of the game it is an awesome buy. Just don't exprect no errors to happen because it is early access. So if you like dungeon games and killing mobs leveling and crafting. An like doing it with friends. Join the game now and either join someone guild or make your own at level 3. Either way i'll be online and if you are not. Sucks to be you, Hope to see all of you who read this online soon.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This, just isn't fun the way they have it set up now. I've spent more time running around aimlessly around large and largely unpopulated maps, with absolutely no idea where I'm supposed to go, than I've spent actually doing something enjoyable in the game.

There's just, a whole lot of really basic elements you'd expect to have in a game that just aren't there, and alot of what is there is giving me that wtf look. Basic things like seperate audio controls for sound and music, or the ability to turn the music off. Server disconnects that kick to menu with all progress lost, even in solo play.

Sure, it's a first day release into EA. They might fix things, I hope they do fix things. I still can't review what isn't there.

I would say for those looking to test a new game and real supporters of the EA idea it's worth looking into. For anyone who wanted a new game to play who're willing to deal with incomplete features, wishlist and wait. It's just not there yet.

The more recent update addressed some of my concerns and complaints tabled above, namely the adition of a map feature. It's crude in its presentation but effective. Still needs some more work to flip that thumb around though.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Not trying to be mean here, however this game is more of an alpha than a beta and certainly not ready for early access. If this is their beta, then this game is the equivalent of a game design student project. Definitely not worth the $8 I paid.

The music it starts off with is nice. To be fair I didn't have it crash on me. But the gameplay is uninspired. The level art direction is ugly. It's running down linear narrow paths. It looks like you're a robot transported to a 90's version of a hell level. Why are there robots in hell?

The gameplay is stiff and awkward. It's also slow.

The best thing this game has going for it is the sound design, and whoever modeled the robots. They look cool, and they sound cool. They don't move all that well. The control scheme is plain awkward and stiff. The combat is boring and uninspired.

It's cool if this game was made by students still going to school. I'd be proud of it, but i'd never try and sell it other than a concept to get a job at a real studio.

Kudos to them for trying, but this is beyond embarrassing if you're asking people for money to play this.

voteText: 8 of 16 people (50%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Early Access Review

It's a good prototype for a hack & slay/dungeon crawler, unfortunately it needs quite some polish here and there, but it paves the way for future content - depending how fast these updates are, it probably worth the money.

One of the main issues I have so far, are the inconsistent controls and animations. Sometimes it's doing the full turning animation to move and sometimes it's instant, which creates some disparity in responsiveness. The ground textures also often don't tile correctly into each other, very noticeable in narrow paths and it looks looks very bad. The UI also needs some rework in the future, some text has anti-aliasing and some are very jaggy. Also, add the ability to double click onto items to equip them instead of having to press the 'equip' button. While you're at it, add the ability to use esc or mouse4 to cancel out of menues since the back button is in a very inconvient place which makes you travel quite far to reach it.
Weapons are also somewhat goofy right now. You can keep tapping to bypass the fire rate limit, turning something like an energy launcher which has a firerate of 1, into a minigun.

Overall, it just lacks polish and a lot more content, argueably it also lacks a proper options menue, but I've seen worse.
If there's no update within 2 weeks, I would personally write this off, but as of right now, I can recommend it.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This is hardly playable. I got copies for some friends and I, and after having a hard time connecting to each other we were in for a ride from hell. Not only are the hit-boxes messed up, but the heal gun didn't work, the enemies would fall of the stage but still be able to hit you, and traversing the game was a nightmare.
Do yourself a favor and don't buy this, just wait until it comes out to see if it's worth it. Right now, it's awful.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nIm gonnna lead of with saying this game is early access. With that said, im going to advise you that this game is nearly unplayable atm. I just spent 30 minutes trying to find 10 objectives just to get 9 of them and a migrane. Now usualy i would just chaulk that up to me missing something, but not for a game with one path (i walked both sides 4+ times). Not to mention mutliplayer is not user at all friendly. All of the lobbies are open (no private games), you have to find the game that your friends are in with 0 points of reference, and it makes the game 5x harder. HOWEVER, it is a good concept. Once they smooth out some of these rough edges (and a few other things) this game could be a lot of fun.
